segment.source: The following features can be used with devices running in Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: The following features can be used with devices running in Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: Optional features for Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Optional features for Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: Optional features for Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Optional features for Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: The following features can be used with devices running in Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: The following features can be used with devices running in Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: Note All optional features included with Windows 10 Mobile can be used, too.
segment.target: Note All optional features included with Windows 10 Mobile can be used, too.

segment.source: For more info about the other optional features, see Optional features for building images.
segment.target: For more info about the other optional features, see Optional features for building images.

segment.source: Feature
segment.target: Feature

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: BCDEDIT
segment.target: BCDEDIT

segment.source: Adds bcdedit.exe to the image for development support.
segment.target: Adds bcdedit.exe to the image for development support.

segment.source: This should not be included in final retail images.
segment.target: This should not be included in final retail images.

segment.source: MFGMODEBCD
segment.target: MFGMODEBCD

segment.source: Adds the BCD entry to enable Manufacturing Mode in the full OS Image.
segment.target: Adds the BCD entry to enable Manufacturing Mode in the full OS Image.

segment.source: You should remove this before the device leaves the factory floor.
segment.target: You should remove this before the device leaves the factory floor.

segment.source: MFGSTARTUP
segment.target: MFGSTARTUP

segment.source: Adds startup.bsc file to the Manufacturing Mode image and is needed whenever the MOBILECOREBOOTSH feature is used.
segment.target: Adds startup.bsc file to the Manufacturing Mode image and is needed whenever the MOBILECOREBOOTSH feature is used.

segment.source: MFGDEVTOOLS
segment.target: MFGDEVTOOLS

segment.source: Adds a collection of useful developer tools to the Manufacturing Mode image, such as tlist.exe, sc.exe, shutdown.exe.
segment.target: Adds a collection of useful developer tools to the Manufacturing Mode image, such as tlist.exe, sc.exe, shutdown.exe.

segment.source: This should not be included in the final Manufacturing Mode image.
segment.target: This should not be included in the final Manufacturing Mode image.

segment.source: MFGTELNETFTP
segment.target: MFGTELNETFTP

segment.source: Adds Telnet and TFTP servers to the Manufacturing Mode image.
segment.target: Adds Telnet and TFTP servers to the Manufacturing Mode image.

segment.source: You can leave them in the final image for servicing since they only run when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: You can leave them in the final image for servicing since they only run when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: MFGTSHELL
segment.target: MFGTSHELL

segment.source: Adds TShell capability to the Manufacturing Mode image.
segment.target: Adds TShell capability to the Manufacturing Mode image.

segment.source: You can leave it in the final image for servicing since it only runs when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: You can leave it in the final image for servicing since it only runs when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: MOBILECOREBOOTSH
segment.target: MOBILECOREBOOTSH

segment.source: Enables the bootsh service (bootshscv) so that features in startup.bsc, such as telnet and ftp, can be used.
segment.target: Enables the bootsh service (bootshscv) so that features in startup.bsc, such as telnet and ftp, can be used.

segment.source: This is required when the MFGTELNETFTP feature is specified.
segment.target: This is required when the MFGTELNETFTP feature is specified.

segment.source: You can leave it in the image for servicing since it only runs when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: You can leave it in the image for servicing since it only runs when the device is in Manufacturing Mode.
